code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:a 54 yo white M reports mild cough. Also complains of moderate wheezing that worsens in cold air from time to time. o:Height 76 in, Weight 208 lbs, Temperature 98.4 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 17, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered Arterial Blood Gas.

content2.Unmatched: o/w cta - b , Heart = RRR , Normal S

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

td.content: s:a male aged 55 Ys complains of mild cough for 5 weeks. o:Height 75 in, Weight 207 lbs, Temperature 99 F, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 112, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 17, nose = no nasal congestion, NAD, normocephalic/atraumatic (nc/at), Pulm: mild LLL wheeze o/w cta-b, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, CTA-LL, wheeze-LU, PERRL, A&O x 3, wheeze-BIL, Chest: RRR, No M/G/R a:Asthma p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed Albuterol ("rescue inhaler") - 2.5 mg as needed for SOB, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/VFC, PEF, Pulse Oximetry.

content2.Unmatched: o/w cta - b , Heart = RRR , Normal S
